content:
Hello Arlev,

The OS was not on "Dark Mode activated".

I found the source of the problem : last week-end, I installed Cinnamon Desktop to test it. After that, each time I opened a session (in Gnome, Gnome Classical or in Cinnamon), Thunderbird was in Dark Mode. Some of Cinnamon's packages was blocking Thunderbird in Dark Mode. I remove Cinnamon Desktop and everything is OK now.

Thank your for your help.

content: Copy the mbox files (without the .mbox extension) to the Mail/Local Folders location of the profile, with TB closed. They will be visible under Local Folders in the Folder Pane when TB is restarted. If you wish to have Local Folders in other places besides the default location, there is an add-on. To just change the location from the default one, see this article.

content:
This is the normal process. Please describe what you did: Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is not running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there

AND, there is a terrific little tool for screenshots, Sniptool, FREE at https://www.reasyze.com/
creator: davidsk

content:
Hi, if you do not get a right-click context menu when right-clicking in Firefox, you can hold down the Shift key to override whatever the page is doing to suppress the menu. Does that work in Thunderbird?

It sounds like CardBook is the following extension for Thunderbird: https://addons.thunderbird.net/thunderbird/addon/cardbook/

If you can copy/paste from other parts of Thunderbird, it could be an add-on issue:

The developer provided the following information for support:

GitLab: https://gitlab.com/CardBook/CardBook Forum: https://cardbook.icu/forum/ Report a problem: support@cardbook.icu

If you also have problems with copy/paste from email messages or built-in contact fields:

Could you describe the other problems? That might help in narrowing down the cause of the issue.
creator: jscher2000

content: Thank you jscher2000. Holding down the shift option fixed my problem. I do not have issues like the one above in other parts of Thunderbird. I have a feeling the problem occurred when Thunderbird and Cardbook took over for CardDAV recently but I can not be sure.
